author: gcolvin
content:
> Right now it could be on the order of a 15 million item stack (all PUSH0s in an unrolled loop)
Actually, I think that would be 480M bytes, which would push get_callframe_byte_size() way over the 30M limit.  And you can get to that limit with a single MSTORE, so PUSH0 would be a much more expensive way to extend memory.  If so, the question is just whether 30M is too much -- but if it is we are already in trouble.
